campsites.name: Taiwan Oolong tea
campsites.description: Taiwan High-Moutain Oolong tea brews a lilac flavor that is smooth with a fresh orchid finish. Oolong tea leaves are hand-picked and basket tossed in a process known as oxidization.

campsites.name: Japan Matcha
campsites.description: Japanese matcha provides a rich, complex taste and a boost of calm energy for the day.

campsites.name: China White Tea
campsites.description: Silver-tipped white tea harvested at the base of the Himalayas in Darjeeling. Rare and unique bud and leaf grades are hand harvested in small quantities. Deliver a delicate flavor profile and smooth round finish.

campsites.name: Oriental Beauty Tea
campsites.description: This robust black tea brews smooth and malty, with a clean finish. Perfect for starting the day!

comments.text: Taiwan High Mountain Oolong has become my go-to morning ritual. The delicate floral notes, coupled with a light, refreshing aftertaste, make every cup a serene journey. It's not just tea; it's an experience that awakens the senses.
comments.author: Simon Liu

comments.text: Each sip transitions from a buttery smoothness to a sweet, almost peach-like finish.
comments.author: Zandra Suzanne

comments.text: The leaves unfurl beautifully, releasing a subtle yet profound aroma. It's a gentle reminder of nature's simplicity and sophistication.
comments.author: Wendy Wang

comments.text: Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I found Taiwan High Mountain Oolong slightly underwhelming. It's certainly a fine tea, but I was hoping for a more robust flavor profile.
comments.author: Jean Chen

comments.text: There's a soothing quality to this tea that I've come to rely on during stressful days. It's my little escape to tranquility, offering a calm that I cherish deeply.
comments.author: R. E. Kim

comments.text: There's a robust grassiness at first sip, followed by a lingering, sweet aftertaste. It's this balance between earthiness and sweetness that makes it so captivating.
comments.author: Juan Wang

comments.text: Matcha's natural sweetness shines in desserts, providing a nuanced flavor that's hard to replicate.
comments.author: McKenzie Sebastian

comments.text: I can see its appeal to others, especially with its health benefits, but it's not my cup of tea.
comments.author: Brennen Ech

comments.text: here's a depth to matcha that I find immensely satisfying.
comments.author: Amy Keophilavong

comments.text: its earthy, umami richness to the challenges some face with its grassy bitterness.
comments.author: Jordan Runn

comments.text: The Frozen Tundra is great place for family and friends camping!
comments.author: Olaf the Snowman

comments.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the complexity hidden within the seeming simplicity of this tea.
comments.author: Vincent and Mona Lisa Gambini

comments.text: It's my go-to choice for moments of peaceful contemplation!
comments.author: Ann Dabramov

comments.text: It's an acquired taste, but one that offers rich rewards to the patient tea drinker.
comments.author: Amy Keophilavong

comments.text: I've been impressed by its benefits. Not only is it low in caffeine, but it also seems to have a calming effect on my days.
comments.author: Dave Lister

comments.text: he natural fruity sweetness, complemented by a hint of spice, creates a melody that dances across the palate.
comments.author: Markell Lin

comments.text: The leaves, with their beautiful array of colors, brew into a tea that's both visually and gustatorily stunning.
comments.author: Amy Cheng

comments.text: The pronounced sweetness and floral undertones were a bit too overpowering for my taste!
comments.author: Tina Pan

comments.text: The sites are huge! We felt like we were in the middle of nowhere, in a good way.
comments.author: Chloe Haskins

comments.text: It's a special treat I reserve for moments when I want to indulge in something truly exceptional.
comments.author: Minae Lee
test
comments.text: test

partners.name: Tea Arts & Culture
partners.description: Tea Arts & Culture is committed to bringing people together to explore, cultivate, and share an appreciation of tea.

partners.name: World Tea Expo
partners.description: An infusion of fresh ideas for the new era of tea!

partners.name: Global Japanese Tea Association
partners.description: Global Japanese Tea Association is a membership-driven, non-profit, non-governmental organization that aims to spark growth in the Japanese tea world

partners.name: Brewing Tea
partners.description: Introduction to Chinese Tea Ceremony to learn the basics of performing Chinese Tea Ceremony.

promotions.name: Taiwanese tea tasting with fine dining
promotions.description: Combining notes of cooling mint with the taste of smooth, decadent chocolate in a bold infusion.

promotions.name: Green Pomegranate Iced Tea
promotions.description: Select organic green tea hand-tossed in a large wok, dried to perfection, then carefully blended with organic raspberries and essence of pomegranate.

promotions.name: Rose Tea
promotions.description: Rose tea, a floral, was designed to restore balance in the body, mind, and soul..
